summary.long: Titus is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s chosen ones and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in hope of eternal life, which God, who can’t lie, promised before time began;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but in his own time revealed his word in the message with which I was entrusted according to the commandment of God our Savior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to Titus, my true child according to a common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I left you in Crete for this reason, that you would set in order the things that were lacking and appoint elders in every city, as I directed you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if anyone is blameless, the husband of one wife, having children who believe, who are not accused of loose or unruly behavior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the overseer must be blameless, as God’s steward, not self-pleasing, not easily angered, not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for dishonest gain;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but given to hospitality, a lover of good, sober minded, fair, holy, self-controlled,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: holding to the faithful word which is according to the teaching, that he may be able to exhort in the sound doctrine, and to convict those who contradict him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are also many unruly men, vain talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose mouths must be stopped: men who overthrow whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for dishonest gain’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, a prophet of their own, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, and idle gluttons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This testimony is true. For this cause, reprove them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not paying attention to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the pure, all things are pure, but to those who are defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They profess that they know God, but by their deeds they deny him, being abominable, disobedient, and unfit for any good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But say the things which fit sound doctrine,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that older men should be temperate, sensible, sober minded, sound in faith, in love, and in perseverance,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that older women likewise be reverent in behavior, not slanderers nor enslaved to much wine, teachers of that which is good,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they may train the young wives to love their husbands, to love their children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to be sober minded, chaste, workers at home, kind, being in subjection to their own husbands, that God’s word may not be blasphemed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise, exhort the younger men to be sober minded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all things show yourself an example of good works. In your teaching, show integrity, seriousness, incorruptibility,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and soundness of speech that can’t be condemned, that he who opposes you may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say about us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Exhort servants to be in subjection to their own masters and to be well-pleasing in all things, not contradicting,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not stealing, but showing all good fidelity, that they may adorn the doctrine of God, our Savior, in all things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: instructing us to the intent that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we would live soberly, righteously, and godly in this present age;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: looking for the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity and purify for himself a people for his own possession, zealous for good works.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say these things and exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no one despise you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remind them to be in subjection to rulers and to authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good work,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to speak evil of no one, not to be contentious, to be gentle, showing all humility toward all men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the kindness of God our Savior and his love toward mankind appeared,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not by works of righteousness which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy, he saved us through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom he poured out on us richly through Jesus Christ our Savior;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that being justified by his grace, we might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This saying is faithful, and concerning these things I desire that you insist confidently, so that those who have believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but shun foolish questionings, genealogies, strife, and disputes about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Avoid a factious man after a first and second warning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that such a one is perverted and sinful, being self-condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis, for I have determined to winter there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Send Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey speedily, that nothing may be lacking for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let our people also learn to maintain good works to meet necessary needs, that they may not be unfruitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in faith.
Grace be with you all. Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
